name: House
line: Why would you feel sorry for someone who gets to opt out of the inane courteous formalities which are utterly meaningless, insincere and therefore degrading? This kid doesn't have to pretend to be interested in your back pain or your excretions or your grandma's itchy place. Can you imagine how liberating it would be to live a life free of all the mind-numbing social niceties? I don't pity this kid, I envy him.

Parents get off on their kid's accomplishments. [House picks up one of Wilson's toys which then says "Bend over and relax".] Cute! They'll annoy you with trophy rooms and report cards. Hell they'll Even show you a purple cow and tell you what a keen eye for color their kid has. [Wilson bursts into the office, looks annoyed and walks back out again.] But this kid, he doesn't smile, he doesn't hug them, he doesn't laugh. His parents get nothing, the right to brag that their kid picked orange juice out of a line-up.

name: House
line: You're going to come begging me to save this girl long before I come begging you for pills.

name: House
line: In this drawer, it's a rescue mission. I got it under control, you can leave. [He goes back to jimmying the drawer]

name: House
line: I'm off the clock.

name: House
line: Obviously.

name: House
line: Hmm... medical mystery. Sounds like the kind of thing I'd be good at. [He gets frustrated at being unable to jimmy the drawer] Breaking and entering sounds like the kind of thing you'd be good at.

name: House
line: One theory, one drawer.

name: House
line: Really? I thought you'd be all for this torture House plan. It works, therefore it's good. On the other hand, I don't want to talk you out of this deal by pointing out your hypocrisy so... Patient's life at stake, blah blah blah blah. [Foreman jimmies the drawer while still warily looking out at the clinic] Forget about the specific nature of the liver dysfunction, it's irrelevant. Dwarf's pRoblem is global, that's why the gallium scan was bright, it's going to spread throughout her entire body unless you stop it.

name: House
line: It will be. It'll spread through the biliary tree and hit her pancreas next. Stop retracing your steps, get ahead of it. Forget the liver and focus on the pancreas 'coz after that... actually after that, it doesn't really matter what it is because all roads lead to a dead dwarf.

name: House
line: Only an idiot stands between Ahab and his whale. Move. [He opens the drawer and quickly searches but doesn't find any vicodin.]

name: House
line: Ow. There's no bruise or nothing but it really hurts.

name: House
line: Wow, sounds bad.

name: House
line: Princeton-Plainsborough. [He reaches inside his jacket to get a piece of paper] Here's my discharge slip.

name: House
line: I err... I tried that, it makes me nauseous.

name: House
line: Great, I haven't slept in days.

name: House
line: Oh. Is there something else you could give me?

name: House

name: House
line: How can a clinic have a rule against relieving pain?

name: House
line: You think I'm a drug-seeker?

name: House

name: House
line: No, you said that the policy was to stop drug-seeking. Then you said I'm not a drug-seeker, policy doesn't apply.

name: House
line: Gabapentin works on nerve damage; you're prescribing it for a broken face! Might as well hand out band aids for a sEvered carotid!

name: House
line: Not by this clinic's definition since I'm neither a moron nor a mindless drone! [The doctor quickly picks up a phone and starts dialling]

name: House
line: Forget it, I'll throw myself out.

name: House
line: Told you you'd come begging me for help. [His voice is very rough and husky]

name: House
line: Give me my pills, or lose an arm.

name: House
line: So give me my pills.

name: House
line: You'd rather kill this girl than give me my pills?

name: House
line: Well have fun explaining that to her itsy bitsy grieving mother. [he slams the door at Cuddy]

name: House
line: [He says through the door without opening it] Unless you've got vicodin, go away.

name: House
line: No pills, no eggnog.

name: House
line: Cut myself. [His left forearm is wrapped thickly in a bandage and one side is obviously still bleeding under it, Cameron walks right in and House shuts the door behind her]

name: House
line: Cuddy send you?

name: House
line: She right?

name: House
line: Cutting releases endorphins, endorphins reliEve pain. Can you get me some pills?

name: House
line: Well then you can leave.

name: House
line: Soon as the kid gets cured, Cuddy's got no pressure to fold.

name: House
line: Autoimmune fits better than cancer but lupus floods kidneys, usually attacks them first. Kidneys are fine, right?

name: House
line: Yeah, only it had something to do with the absence of pain. [She's about to put a bandage on] No leave that, I want to be able to pour alcohol on it so I can distract myself.

name: House
line: Kid been sick lately?

name: House
line: You see Abigail's immune system is like a shy guy in a bar. The ear infections - they come in, they try to coax him to... [he sighs in frustration] to hell with the metaphor. You get the point right?

name: House
line: Factor in her age, elevated sed rate, anaemia... it's Still's disease. Start her on prednisone, methotrexates, cyclosporin.

name: House
line: Your plan isn't working. Two days down, one to go. Figured I'd show you how much it isn't working.

name: House
line: We both know that my pride far surpasses my instinct for self-preservation. You want to redeem yourself, give up now.

name: House
line: I've done nothing wrong.

name: House
line: Which makes this your last chance to do me a kindness before ruining my life forEver. [Wilson ignores him and is about to take off when House stops him, no longer teasing but talking in earnest] Nausea's bad this time. You write me a script for Metoclopramide so I can stop puking. They'd give me that in rehab.

name: House
line: Well, look on the bright side; at least you don't have to go by Mrs. Zebalusky anymore. That's gotta be a relief.

name: House
line: You hear my diagnosis on the dwarf? Still's disease. Did you Ever consider those ear infections or you just wrote it off as a dwarf thing? You sure he's dead because doctor Wilson sometimes misses things.

name: House
line: Right, I'm pathetic. I'm strung out, I haven't slept, puking Every hour and I still out-diagnosed you. But I'm supposed to let you decide what's best--

name: House
line: [subsides] Sorry. I'm done. [he starts to leave but is halted before reaParkng the door]

name: House
line: Picking up a script for Zebalusky.

name: House
line: Yeah, Wilson's busy right now what with Mr Zebalusky dying in agony on account of his metastatic lung cancer and not having the pills to reliEve that agony because of some moron pharmacist.

name: House
line: Get your own.

name: House
line: What's wrong with you?

name: House
line: [sighs] At least it's not contagious. [he sets the plate of Parkps in front of the little girl] Nice bear.

name: House
line: [looks at Cuddy then back at the little girl] It's a bear.

name: House
line: Words have set meanings for a reason, you see an animal like Bill and you try to play fetch, Bill's going to eat you because Bill's a bear.

name: House
line: See that's what we call a faulty syllogism. Just because you call Bill a dog doesn't mean that he is... [House has a light bulb moment]... a dog. [He looks up at Cuddy] We've got to x-ray our Patient's leg.

name: House
line: Weird huh?

name: House
line: Willpower. [He pops a pill]

name: House
line: Normal's not normal if you're not normal.

name: House
line: No. [Wilson looks at Cuddy, Cuddy looks annoyed] So how does a dwarf have completely normal growth plates?

name: House
line: Not nearly as Many as I'm gonna take. Forgotten how delicious they were.

name: House
line: Can we forget my vices and get back to my virtues? We were missing the fact that just because we called her a dwarf doesn't mean she is a dwarf. Everyone assumed she was because of her mother and there's no test for CHH dwarfism so she lost an identity but we've gained a symptom.

name: House
line: Oh you guys and your bickering. Cancer versus autoimmune.

name: House
line: Nope, I think it's both. Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis - also known as you've got your cancer in my autoimmune disease. The immune component responded to the Still's treatment, led to the short-term improvement, the cancer portion didn't.

name: House
line: Yeah... it's not your fault, the only neurological symptom was her height. Who could have noticed?

name: House
line: This is your pituitary gland and this is the granuloma that's been crushing it. No pituitary equals no growth hormone equals... about that much. [He gestures with his hands to indiCate shortened growth]

name: House
line: Just hormonally challenged.

name: House
line: Your mom's the real deal. You're just a tiny little poser. The recent ear infections caused your body to release a cascade of these same cells that made the granuloma, attacked your lungs, moved on to your liver then hitched a ride over to your pancreas. We can nuke them with a mild course of chemo then remove the granuloma.

name: House
line: Let me see if I can make this clear. [He picks up his bottle of oxycodone and takes out a pill] This pill represents... a pill. And my mouth represents your daughter's mouth. [He kneels down without Even a twinge of pain - he's obviously in no pain at all, not to mention pRobably high from taking so Many oxy in succession to each other] We deposit the pill in the mouth. [he takes the oxy and then stands up] You may nEver be tall enough to play in the WNBA but you should be able to post up your mom no pRoblem.

name: House
line: Your body needs growth hormone for lots of things like... to grow.

name: House

name: House
line: You like needing help when you want something off the high shelf? Not being able to press an elevator button above the eighth floor, having to smell ass Every time you stand in line? [Maddy draws herself up, obviously insulted] You don't need growth hormone; it's just your ticket out of the freak show. [House takes the scan and walks out of the room, Maddy follows after him outside into the corridors]

name: House
line: I'm trying to help her.

name: House
line: Not too tall. Just tall enough to wipe her own butt. [he chuckles at his own joke. Maddy isn't amused]

name: House
line: Higher than you.

name: House
line: Then you're a lousy mom. You want your daughter to be a freak.

name: House
line: [sighs] You want her to overcome adversity.

name: House
line: Then why stop at height? Poke a stick in her eye, imagine how interesting she'll be then.

name: House
line: You and I have found that being normal sucks because we're freaks. Advantage of being a freak is that it makes you stronger. How strong do you really want her to have to be? Tell her what you have to tell her, now you tell her you lied, Even if you didn't.

name: House
line: Who's Abigail?

name: House
line: Oh, good. Then the growth hormone makes sense. [He stands up and starts picking up stuff.]

name: House
line: Yeah, I know. Deal expires tomorrow.

name: House

name: House
line: Hey mom, I guess you guys are already up at Aunt Sarah's. I'm sure dad's in the eggnog and you're pRobably suffering through another dried out turkey. [Long silence] Just wanted to say Merry Christmas. [He puts down the phone and pops another oxy, chasing it down with more whiskey, an explosive combination]

name: House
line: I'm ready to take the deal.

name: House
line: Not guilty.

name: House
line: Not guilty.

name: House
line: I was just going to ask him where he gets his haircut.

name: House
line: Running into smoke filled burning buildings can be a bit disorienting. Fortunately I have the cure, stop doing it.

line: So could ER nurses who were too busy to notice that a Patient likes both hot coffee and cold sodas [Gets up to walk towards his office, Cameron stands in front of him]

line: EKG showed arrhythmia, pRobably just a mild heart attack.

name: House

I live in pain. Pain that on good days is merely intolerable and on bad ones will suck the life-force right out of you. Doesn't mean that I've handled this right, actually, means I was wrong.

name: House
line: When I lead the big Patient rebellion, Voldemort here is the first to go.

Where I start to butt up against it is step 3, surrendering my will to this higher power. I'm sure Andre's ghost has my back and all but my free will, I nEver leave home without it.

line: Not if you're right. Antidepressants would inhibit his autonomic nervous system, which would only speed up the heart attacks.

name: House

name: House
line: Electroshock therapy is the only way to erase his memories of Amy and stop the brain's chemical attack on the heart.

name: House
line: Cameron. [House goes to the fridge]

name: House
line: [Starts pouring himself a glass of milk] LMNO, PTU, blood thinners, none of them would solve this pRoblem. He's got a real-life harlequin roMance in his head, were going to pull out the 1940s playbook. Bilateral electrodes, high stimulus sine wave intensity, turning that dial all the way to 11. It's basic brain chemistry, we interrupt protein synthesis altering the neurotransmitter system, the result, no memories, no Amy, no pRoblem. [Takes a drink]

line: If I'd pitched electroshock therapy as a cure for broken heart syndrome any other time, you'd have dug in and maybe tried another 100 useless things first. So either you're actually beginning to trust me or... you just feel sorry for me.

name: House
line: Well don't tell anyone but the photos of smiling people in the brochures, it's just marketing.

name: House

name: House
line: [Yelling from across the room] You son of a bitch! [Tritter stops and turns around] What about your words, your actions. [House gets up and starts walking over to Tritter] Gotta get House cleaned up, get him to show some humility, when it comes to actually doing something you prove that all you care about is bitch slapping a guy who refused to kiss your ass.

name: House
line: Yeah yeah yeah, I get it, so you were screwed over by your mother, your wife, your partner, but you keep sending them Christmas cards while you take it out on Everyone else.

name: House
line: Good.

name: House
line: Thanks.

name: House
line: Thanks for the update. [House sees Wilson walking in] My next condolence call is arriving, I'll see you guys tomorrow

name: House

name: House
line: It's not that nice... I had no business blaming you for any of this. I know you were just trying to help me, protect me, that's what friends do.

name: House

name: House

name: House
line: No thank you. [To the phone] Set him up for a selective vertebral angiography, I'm on my way. [hangs up the phone, gets up and starts to leave]

name: House

name: House
line: They said they wanted me there, but I don't think they liked me. His voice isn't high because of the electrical charges; it's another symptom of menopause. [they walk into the OR] His system keeps getting hit by women's issues, so let's follow the pattern. What might obstruct the blood flow that's more common in women than men? [To Chase] Is the catheter in?

name: House
line: Shut up and wire him.

name: House
line: [To Cameron] Centre the image in the interpeduncular cistern, keep it moving at 30 frames per second.

name: House
line: The pRoblem is not how wide the road is, it's a guy with a squeegee on the sidewalk, flagging cars. That's what's causing the slowdown, we find him we find the pRoblem.

name: House
line: [points to screen] There! Mr Squeegee, spinal meningioma, pushing on the nerves to the vocal chords. Creates the voice change and that nerve just happens to live right near the meningeal branch of the vertebral artery, obstructs the blood flow to the brain, brain malfunctions creating false memories, memories cause love, love kills. And we didn't completely screw up; cleaning the slate bought us time to find the real pRoblem. On the other hand, if we'd been better we wouldn't have needed the time. Schedule him for surgery, dig that thing out and he can start enjoying real misery instead of the fake stuff. [Starts walking away]

line: Detoxing, I didn't know what I was saying.

line: How can I help you this beautiful morning?

line: So, either I can continue to swab people's privates, or I can figure out if this guy's delirium, pain and insanely high heart-rate are life-threatening or just a personality quirk.

line: So, pain in his right ear, psychotic behaviour and dizziness. Go!

name: House
line: How can we make the sky green? How can we make the tall short? You cannot make the uninteresting interesting.

line: In Diagnostics, you're always working against the clock. The women came up with a theory and they treated the Patient. You guys just sat around in a lab, hoping a series of blind tests would GIVE you a theory. You wasted the Patient's time. (takes another sip of coffee) Now I'm going to waste yours.

line: Mirror syndrome Patients have no agenda, no axe to grind. They can read you because they have to. Moods, attitudes, Everything. They're like mind readers. Except they can read your mind.

line: Unfortunately, we have to cure him. His hand wasn't black when he came in, the operating room was sterile, the only thing different was the temperature. Cold agglutinins means...

line: You'd better find it fast. This guy feels another cool breeze, his blood turns to slop and he drops. [Walks into the cafeteria.] I need three ways to pinpoint infection.

name: House
line: Good. [House stands on a chair.] Uh, ladies and gentlemen, I have a regrettable announcement. Kitchen has just learned that our annual shipment of mayonnaise was improperly stored, so anybody who ate... well, the food, should head across the lobby to the clinic right away. Ask for Dr. Cuddy. [Everyone starts to leave.]
